channel.title: titanic on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in titanic on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] First data analysis/machine learning (Kaggle)
item.description: #Introduction As I was about to get a job (spring break in the fourth year of university), I suddenly wanted to become a data scientist, so I started working on Kaggle for the time being. This time, I worked on a tutorial of Kaggle"Titanic”. I have experience in statistical analysis in my research, but since I do not understand machine learning at all, I decided to study with reference to the code of the incredibly excellent person!

item.title: Predict Titanic survival using Kedro, a machine learning workflow management tool
item.description: #Introduction In this article, I will build a Titanic survival prediction workflow using a library called Kedro. Recently, there are many types of machine learning workflow management tools and construction support tools. Just what I’ve heard, Apache Airflow luigi -gokart Dagster Metaflow DataBolt(d6t) Kedro And so on. Let’s compare the performance of these tools through a common prediction project! That is the origin of this article. As a common project, we chose Titanic survival prediction, which is a path that anyone should go through once they start data analysis.

item.title: Kaggle Tutorial Know-how in the top 2% of Titanic
item.description: #1.First of all Since I started studying machine learning, I tried Kaggle’s tutorial for beginners, Titanic. At first, I tried to play around with the feature amount on my own, referring to Japanese Web information, but even if the training data showed good accuracy, when I submitted the test data, the accuracy did not rise as expected, It was difficult to break the wall of 80% and I was in agony.
